meanings.definition: To remove a rope or ropes from something.
meanings.sent1: She was unroping the boat from the dock.
meanings.sent2: After unroping the horse, she led it to the pasture.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved unroping a knot without touching it.
meanings.sent4: He unroped himself from the situation, freeing himself from the constraints.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter skillfully unroped the trapped cat from the tree.

meanings.definition: The act of removing a rope or ropes from something.
meanings.sent1: The unroping of the ship was done swiftly by the crew.
meanings.sent2: She watched the unroping of the flag ceremony with interest.
meanings.sent3: The unroping of the tangled cords resembled a dance performance.
meanings.sent4: The unroping of the old bridge symbolized the end of an era.
meanings.sent5: The unroping of the sails signaled the start of the sailing race.
